The search for novel and low-cost cocatalysts that can achieve high efficiency meanwhile maintain high selectivity in photocatalytic CO 2 reduction is highly desirable yet remains

calculated charge distribution of Ni 3 B, which indicates that charges are accumulated on the Ni-B bond.This unique feature enables Ni-B bond acting as electron accumulator to store electrons, which can provide abundant long-lived electrons to be injected into the Ni 0 active sites for the activation of CO 2 during photocatalytic reactions.The timeresolved PL decay spectroscopy was then utilized to experimentally reveal the dynamic charge behavior of the photocatalytic system. 39
